name: Aristotle
what_did:
Aristotle studied many things: animals, planets, logic, and how people live.
He was a student of Plato and later taught Alexander the Great.
He wanted to understand the world by observing it carefully and asking why things happen.
why_matters:
Aristotle's ideas shaped science, logic, and philosophy for centuries.
He helped people learn to think clearly and ask smart questions.
Many of his ideas were used for over 1,000 years!

options: Many things, like science and logic

questions.q: How did Aristotle learn about the world?

fun_fact: Aristotle’s writings covered almost every subject — even how bees build hives!
